item.title: Quake Wars coming to Mac in December, currently in alpha (screenshots)
item.description: Enemy Territory: Quake Wars, the new class-based multiplayer designed around a modified version of id Software's Doom 3 engine and MegaTexture rendering technology, is making its way to Intel-based Macs with a release pencilled in for early December. Since the Mac version remains under active development, AppleInsider won't yet comment on performan

item.description: This cute and sporty beetle-esque electric car comes with optional photovoltaics for solar power, and will be powered by

item.title: Iwata comments that the Wii could last longer than the usual 5 years
item.description: Most Nintendo consoles only last five years on the market. Iwata says until they can innovate beyond the Wii, the company doesn't see the need for a new console anytime in the future.

item.title: How to loose a race in the last second
item.description: Bad Karma, the price of being cocky.

item.title: Sony to launch new lighter PlayStation 2
item.description: The newly designed PlayStation 2 will hit stores in Japan on November 22 with a recommended price tag of 140 dollars. The internal design architecture of the new system has been completely overhauled.

item.title: All 6 Rocky Movies Explained... in a Single 10 Second Clip
item.description: The entire Rocky movies series, starring Sylvester Stallone condensed to a 10 second clip. Lame but pretty funny.

item.title: The War Against BitTorrent: Attack of the ISPs
item.description: There has been a lot of fuss lately about Comcast’s efforts to throttle and interfere with BitTorrent traffic, but they are by no means the only ISP involved in such efforts. Hundreds of larger and smaller ISPs all around the world try to limit BitTorrent traffic on their networks, time to give an overview, the war is on.

item.title: Tesla Coils Playing Mario Bros. Theme song... Unsurprisingly Awesome
item.description: Twin Solid State Musical Tesla coils playing Mario Bros theme song at the 2007 Lightning on the Lawn Teslathon sponsored by DC Cox (Resonance Research Corp) in Baraboo WI. The music that you hear is coming from the sparks that these two identical high power solid state Tesla coils are generating. There are no speakers involved.

item.title: Assassination of Tamil Leader Prompts Fears of Sri Lankan Civil War
item.description: Decades-long civil war between Sinhalese government and Tamil rebels took a turn for the worse. A Tamil leader was killed with 5 of his associates in an air strike by the Sri Lankan military. Analysts suggest this could be the beginning of a return to a full-scale war. Democracy Now! speaks to Sri Lankan Tamil democracy activist Ahilan Kadirgamar.

item.title: Battle over PATRIOT Act appeal brews as critical testimony is gagged
item.description: The government has appealed a ruling that was issued last month by a federal court judge striking down the controversial National Security Letter provision of the PATRIOT Act. Gag orders are preventing a proper and full investigation, however.

item.title: The 20 Best Movie Death Scenes
item.description: Many horror films serve as intelligent social commentaries on the fears and flaws of the time in which they are made. That being said, some are just excuses to show horny teenagers getting gutted. Here are some of the best scenes from both kinds.

item.title: Hungry Kitty
item.description: I is hungry

item.title: Sexy Red PSP With TV Tuner And Stand Coming To Japan
item.description: Coming Dec 13th.

item.title: Senate Panel Probes 6 Top Televangelists for Possible Financial Misconduct
item.description: The Iowa Republican Sen. Charles Grassley is trying to determine whether or not these ministries are improperly using their tax-exempt status as churches to shield lavish lifestyles. Because they have tax status as churches, the ministries do not have to file IRS 990 forms like other non-profit organizations - leaving much financial info private.

item.title: How to make hashish
item.description: Hashish from Arabic:حشيش ḥashīsh, lit. grass; also hash or many slang terms. This video give you step by step instructions on how to make hash at home with things you have around the house. Stop buying hash on the streets, you don't know what they put in it, make it at home an be sure that it is pure and clean.

item.title: Richard Dawkins To Write Book For Children
item.description: Professor Richard Dawkins, In response to a question at AAI 07, Said that he is contemplating the idea of writing a childrens book.

item.title: UK chooses 'most ludicrous laws'
item.description: These are always a hoot: strange laws still on the books in the UK, US, and abroad

item.title: To Apple Care or Not To Apple Care
item.description: When buying a new mac many people are faced with the hard truth. Macs arn’t cheap, nor are repairs. As you tell the sales person what you would like, or you click the add to cart button on the website, you are prompty presented with a choice, AppleCare. AppleCare is Apple’s extended warrenty program...

item.title: NPR opens up NPR Music for our listening pleasure
item.description: NPR relaunched NPR Music, and I’m in music heaven again.

item.title: Top 100 Mac Apps
item.description: I’ve compiled a list of my top 100 Mac apps for your perusal, since so many people have been asking for it. Thanks to Taylor Olson and Jason for helping me put all the icons and links in place! These apps are certainly Tiger compatible, and most of ‘em work inside Leopard (though the VNC utilities are now unnecessary).

item.title: 19 million savers "oblivious" to interest rates
item.description: Half of people with savings accounts have no idea what their rate of interest it, claims Sainsbury's Bank.

item.title: Outtakes from the first anual Diggnation Thanksgiving Special
item.description: How's that turkey coming Kevin?

item.title: 15 Tips to Restart the Exercise Habit (and How to Keep It)
item.description: It’s been two months since you’ve seen the inside of the gym. Getting sick, family crisis, overtime at work and school papers that needed to get finished all kept you for exercising. Now, the question is: how do you start again?

item.title: The Social Enterprise - What Works, and What Doesn't
item.description: Why should enterprises go social, and what are the compellingreasons for adoption?

item.title: Bush beats Nixon’s disapproval ratings for the 1st time in history
item.description: Sixty-four percent of Americans disapprove of the job President Bush is doing, and for “the first time in the history of the Gallup Poll, 50% say they ’strongly disapprove’ of the president. Richard Nixon had reached the previous high, 48%, just before an impeachment inquiry was launched in 1974.”

item.title: How Joker Meets Batman in The Dark Knight (Spoiler Warning)
item.description: "LatinoReview.com has just reported some news around The Dark Knight. The anonymous source has leaked a huge plot point for the introduction of The Joker and Batman. This might be considered a spoiler, but it just makes us even more excited about the film. Here is what his source has to say..."

item.title: Guy w/ Medical Marijuana Perscription fails drug Test and Gets Fired ...
item.description: When Gary Ross was ordered to take a drug test at his new job, the recently hired computer tech had no doubt the results would come back positive for marijuana. But along with his urine sample, Ross submitted a doctor's recommendation that he smoke pot to alleviate back pain — a document he figured would save him from being fired. Guess again...

item.title: Peter Griffin Lives!! // pic
item.description: I'm convinced that this man is Peter Griffin. That's about it... thanks!

item.title: Ultima - a piece of gaming history (pictures)
item.description: Once upon a time before there was WoW, and actually before many of us existed, a series of games called Ultima was created. 27 years later you probably know it only as Ultima Online, but before MMORPG superceded RPG it was a long-running series of games loved by generations.

item.title: Building an Open Social with Google
item.description: With its swift installation and simple set-up, Elgg provides you with all the tools you need to become the next MySpace. Karl Hodge shows you how it’s done

item.title: Pictures: Fascinating Collection of High-Speed Photography
item.description: These photos are the work of art of Professor Andrew Davidhazy, who has been able to capture anything from an exploding frozen lemon to bullets shredding through playing cards. Most, if not all, of these photographs require special techniques to achieve these results.

item.title: Obama Supporters Tried To Keep Stephen Colbert Off the Ballot
item.description: Two prominent supporters of Illinois Sen. Barack Obama's presidential campaign in South Carolina called state Democratic Party officials and urged them to keep funnyman Stephen Colbert's name off the primary ballot, according to party officials and Obama supporters.

item.title: The Wondrous Vulva Puppet
item.description: Tyra Banks show. Vagina puppet. 'Nuff said...

item.title: Democrats force impeachment proceedings into a committee to die. Spineless!
item.description: Now we are being treated to the spectacle of Democrats who had voted to table/kill the measure changing THEIR votes. They don't want to be in a position of defending Dick Cheney if they don't have to. The Democrats are the same party as the Republicans, and don't want anything to effect Hillary becoming president. We have to stop them!

item.description: Funny Kid Video

item.title: What we learn from the dying
item.description: A doctor shares what his patients’ last moments have taught him

item.title: Jack Thompson a Liar: Was Never Invited to Speak at GDC
item.description: GamePolitics found news that Jack Thompson might be attending the Game Developers Conference as a keynote speaker, but it turns out that the GDC knew nothing of this. Now it looks like Jack is that guy who shows up at the party, swearing that someone there invited him.
